str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A bird, fowl. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ornis; a birdling.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: To fly. Or prolongation petaomai, or contracted ptaomai middle voice of a primary verb; to fly.
Mid-heaven, the middle of heaven, the zenith. From a presumed compound of mesos and ouranos; mid-sky.
Come hither, come, hither, an exclamatory word. From deuro and an imperative form of eimi; come hither!

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A dinner, an afternoon or evening meal. From the same as dapane; dinner, i.e. The chief meal.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
